column4: hi guys, why in ubuntu 8.04.1, in /etc/hosts file, I have 127.0.0.1 and 127.0.1.1 ?
hugleo? is that because of Apache?
ow.. then if my network IP is 192.168.2.5 , and some one from the same network want to access my computer how can I refer them to 127.0.1.1 ?
ips starting with 127 are local to the computer. It means "this computer".
that is, if you ask someone else to connect to your 127.0.0.1, then you're really asking them to connect to their own computer.
http://127.0.0.1 <-- All users that opens that url will be pointed to their own computer.
